alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 09 at 1:49PM CST until March 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Richland County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Friday night through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, plan on snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.For the Winter Storm Watch, travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow may develop Friday evening and continue through Saturday. Increasing southeast winds may lead to whiteout conditions while snow is falling. There will be a break in winds as snow ends late Saturday, but then northerly winds increase once again with additional blowing snow impacts possible Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at travel.dot.nd.gov and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
